text: "Ann Shirley must learn to control her temper," and then read it out loud, chapter about, down by the brook; and we'll be playing ball next week and you've never played ball, Anne. #AnneOfGreenGables

passages.fragment: Ann Shirley must learn to control her temper , '' and then read it out loud
passages.full_quote: "<used>Ann Shirley must learn to control her temper," and then read it out loud</used> so that even the primer class, who couldn't read writing, should understand it

passages.fragment: read it out loud , chapter about , down by the brook
passages.full_quote: And we're going to learn a new song -- Jane Andrews is practicing it up now; and Alice Andrews is going to bring a new Pansy book next week and we're all going to <used>read it out loud, chapter about, down by the brook</used>

passages.fragment: down by the brook ; and we 'll be playing ball next week and you 've never played ball , Anne
passages.full_quote: "We are going to build the loveliest new house <used>down by the brook; and we'll be playing ball next week and you've never played ball, Anne</used>"
